description:
NGC 3576 (Statue of Liberty Nebula)

OTA:……………….CDK17
Camera:………….SBIG STXL11002 with AOX and FW8G (0.63 arsec/pxl)
Observatory:…. Heaven’s Mirror, Chile

EXPOSURES:                
…Red:…………10 x 900 sec.			
…Blue:………..6 x 900		
…Green:……..8 x 900		
…O:…………….20 x 1800		
…H:………….….19 x 1800		
…S:……….…….20 x 1800	
		
Total exposure	33.5 hours. RGB used for stars only
Image Width: 42 arc-minutes
Processed by Alex Woronow (2020) using PixInsight, Skylum, Topaz, 3DLut, SWT

Like most star-birth nebula, NGC 3576 has loops and bubbles of gas pushed outward from the most active sites of star formation. These loops shine by the hypervelocity winds and the intense radiation from the new stars as well as the shock stimulation at the loops’ leading edges.

NGC 3603 (the nebula in the lower left of this image) is not associated with NGC 357. The latter lies at about 9,000 lyr from us while the former lies at more than twice that distance: 20,000 lyrs distant.
title: NGC 3576 (Statue of Liberty Nebula)
